授業目的: To develop the listening and speaking skills sufficient to participate in interactions relevant to the lives of university students in Japan. This includes discussing day-to-day activities in English as well as completing presentations and small-group discussions.
到達目標:
By the end of the course, learners will be better able to:

*speak more fluently on selected topics and tasks;

*use a range of interaction strategies and relevant language to communicate effectively in group work, discussions and daily-life conversations;

*present ideas using a coherent structure, appropriate connecting language, and paralinguistic skills (e.g. eye contact, posture/gestures) for individual presentations;

*use visual aids (e.g. poster/ppt) to effectively support presentation content;

*describe data and statitics and use them in support of an argument; 

*understand English spoken at a rate comparable to moderate-speed native-speaker speech; 

*understand and produce selected features of connected speech common to native speaker English;

*understand English spoken in a range of non-native speaker accents;

*understand and use topic-specific and general, mid-to-low frequency vocabulary items.
特記事項: 【合併】英語IIｂ　１６（経済学部）/英語IIIｂ　１６（経済学部）
授業方法: Classes will be interactive and group-work based, with some language and skills guidance from the teacher. Learners are expected to participate actively in all tasks to gain the maximum benefit to their spoken English skills. There will be a range of spoken tasks, including group discussions, presentations, supported by reading & listening tasks. Materials will include a selection from the textbook as well as additional materials distributed in class and on LUNA.
